| Abundance       | [4%](/wiki/Wand#Generation "Wand")                                              |
| Base price      | 175 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                               |
| Weight          | 7                                                                               |

The **wand of lightning** is a [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

A [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may receive a wand of lightning as part of their starting inventory.

There is a 4% chance that a [randomly-generated wand](/wiki/Wand#Generation "Wand") within the dungeon and its branches will be a wand of lightning. Monsters may generate with the wand as a random [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item").

The [Cyclops](/wiki/Cyclops "Cyclops"), the [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer") [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis"), will always be generated with a wand of lightning on his square.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

[Zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") the wand in a given direction shoots a ray of lightning, dealing 6d6 damage to targets without [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") (including [you](/wiki/You "You") if you are hit by one);[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) monsters hit by the ray are [blinded](/wiki/Blind "Blind") for d50 turns, and the ray may destroy any [rings](/wiki/Rings "Rings") and [wands](/wiki/Wands "Wands") in the inventory of monsters that it hits (including you) unless they have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Monsters that the ray misses are not blinded, nor are those that reflect the ray.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) The ray bounces when it hits walls or targets with reflection.

If a bolt of lightning passes through your square, you are blinded for 6d50 turns unless you are already blind or resistant to blindness, even if it misses you or you have reflection.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) If you zap a wand of lightning directly at yourself, you are blinded for 1–100 turns unless you are already blind or resist blindness, and take 12d6 damage unless shock resistant.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) Being hit by a bolt of lightning [abuses](/wiki/Abuse "Abuse") [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution").

The wand of lightning is itself immune to destruction by lightning rays and sources of shock damage (e.g. chest traps, a returning [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir"), [energy vortices](/wiki/Energy_vortices "Energy vortices") or [electric eels](/wiki/Electric_eel "Electric eel")), and the [ring of shock resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_shock_resistance "Ring of shock resistance") is also immune to rays of lightning.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

Like a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire"), [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with a wand of lightning will burn text into the ground and [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") it; however, doing so will blind you for d50 turns unless you are already blind or resist blindness.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)[\[11\]](#cite_note-11) You can avoid this by cancelling the prompt when asked what to engrave.[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a wand of lightning to break it creates an explosion that deals quadruple the normal damage of applying other wands to yourself and all monsters on surrounding squares, and may destroy rings and wands.[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)

## Strategy

Wands of lightning are a powerful offensive item through much of the game, since very few monsters resist shock; however, it is just as devastating to you should you encounter one in the hands of [an early-game monster](/wiki/GWTWOD "GWTWOD"), and can prove to be an annoyance later on if a [soldier](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") or another monster surprises you with a bolt that destroys valuable rings such as [slow digestion](/wiki/Ring_of_slow_digestion "Ring of slow digestion"). [Reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") is naturally the best defense after shock resistance against monsters with wands of lightning, but it also helps to have a means of curing blindness (e.g. a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")) and a way to safely stash your magical items.

A wand of lightning can be useful to blast apart annoying wands in a hostile monster's inventory, such as a [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging") used by a constantly-fleeing opponent; conversely, avoid using the wand on monsters that have wands and rings you wish to preserve, such as a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") or rings of [levitation](/wiki/Ring_of_levitation "Ring of levitation") and [free action](/wiki/Ring_of_free_action "Ring of free action").

Breaking a wand of lightning can be powerful as a means of crowd control, but will also deal immense damage to you unless you are shock-resistant, and will also endanger valuable rings and wands in your inventory. If doing so, be sure to briefly stash whatever vulnerable items you have in a bag or other container, *unless* you either have none or are otherwise [going to die soon](/wiki/Things_To_Do_If_You%27re_Going_to_Die_Next_Turn "Things To Do If You're Going to Die Next Turn").

The wand of lightning is also a very useful tool to engrave a durable [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") well into even the late-game, particularly for [pacifist](/wiki/Pacifist "Pacifist") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") where you will be reliant on such engravings to deter hostile monsters.

## History

The wand of lightning first appears in [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

## Messages

- You are blinded by the flash!

  You were blinded by a bolt of lightning.

- Your arm tingles.

  While blinded, a bolt of lightning was fired at you and missed.

Wands of lightning are a powerful offensive item through much of the game, since very few monsters resist shock; however, it is just as devastating to you should you encounter one in the hands of an early-game monster, and can prove to be an annoyance later on if a soldier or another monster surprises you with a bolt that destroys valuable rings such as slow digestion.
